intro: Hybanthus hieronymi, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale blue, often with a distinctive yellow or orange spot at the base. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Hybanthus hieronymi is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and gardens.
